intro: Convolvulus siculus subsp. siculus, commonly known as Sicilian bindweed, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm. The plant features hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are trumpet-shaped, usually pink or purple, and bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or disturbed areas.
